str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To interrogate, question, demand of. From epi and erotao; to ask for, i.e. Inquire, seek.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
If. A primary particle of conditionality; if, whether, that, etc.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular

str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
To do that which is good. From agathopoios; to be a well-doer.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
To do harm, do wrong, do evil, commit sin. From kakopoios; to be a bad-doer, i.e. to injure, or to sin.
To save, heal, preserve, rescue. From a primary sos; to save, i.e. Deliver or protect.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
